"定性" vs. "定量"

Please don't let me start...
:::

:::



:::{.notes}

- Epistemology is the most abstract level, dealing with philosophical questions about knowledge itself， Positivism, interpretivism, critical realism.
- Methodology connects epistemology to practical research, Experimental, ethnographic, grounded theory
- Methods are the most concrete level - the actual tools and techniques researchers use to collect and analyze data, Interviews, surveys, statistical analysis
- 定量定性是方法区别，不是方法论区别也不是认识论区别

:::

## 方法论的迁越

::: {.callout-important}

## The foundation of econometric methods

For a sequence of random variables $X_1, X_2, ···, X_n$,

$$
\begin{aligned}
P(X_i \cap X_j) =& P(X_i) \cdot P(X_j), \\
F_{X_i}(x) =& F_{X_j}(x), \quad \forall i, j.
\end{aligned}
$$


:::

::: {.fragment}

> For the last thirty years, empirical social research has been dominated by the sample survey. But as usually practiced...the survey is a sociological meat grinder, tearing the individual from his social context and guaranteeing that [nobody in the study interacts]{.red} with anyone else in it [@Barton1968, p. 1]

:::

:::{.fragment .large style="margin-top: 1em"}
[I]{.red}nterdependence &rarr; [R]{.red}elationships &rarr; [S]{.red}tructure
:::

:::{.notes}

行为体间的相互依赖关系

关系的丈量

## Walks/Paths

::: {.r-stack}

![Seven Bridges of Königsberg](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_sevenBridges.png){fig-align="center" height=550}

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_euler.webp){.fragment fig-align="center" height=600}

:::

:::{.notes}

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W18FDEA1jRQ

柯尼斯堡七桥问题（Seven Bridges of Königsberg）是图论中的著名问题。这个问题是基于一个现实生活中的事例：当时东普鲁士柯尼斯堡（今日俄罗斯加里宁格勒）市区跨普列戈利亚河两岸，河中心有两个小岛。小岛与河的两岸有七条桥连接。在所有桥都只能走一遍的前提下，如何才能把这个地方所有的桥都走遍？

每一座桥视为一条线，桥所连接的地区视为点。这样若从某点出发后最后再回到这点，则这一点的线数必须是偶数，这样的点称为偶顶点。相对的，连有奇数条线的点称为奇顶点。欧拉(Leonhard Euler)论述了，由于柯尼斯堡七桥问题中存在4个奇顶点，它无法实现符合题意的遍历。

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_konigsberg.png){fig-align="center" height=400}

数学界的四大天王（“数学之神”阿基米德、牛顿、“数学王子”高斯、“数学之王”欧拉）

:::

## 记录网络

+ 有向（directed）vs. 无向（Undirected）
+ 有无（binary）vs. 多少（valued）
+ 单线（single）vs. 多线（multiplex）
+ DGP是否会产生影响？
+ [Missing Data]{.red}

:::{.notes}

multiplex：In a multiplex network, each type of interaction between the nodes is described by a single layer network and the different layers of networks describe the different modes of interaction.

DGP：Were responses constrained in some way?

+ List up to 5
+ Roster-based
+ Who do you discuss 'important questions' with?


Boundary, omission of nodes/ties, measurement error (human recall, actual/perceived relationship)

Observed is reliable? (莆田系，笑果文化前台后台)

::::{.columns}

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_coauthor.png){fig-align="center" height=600}

:::

:::{.column width="30%"}

[e.g., n<sub>HY</sub> = 6.]{.fragment}

:::
::::


## 密度

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="60%"}

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_coauthor.png){height=600}

:::

:::{.column width="40%"}

密度公式： $d_i = \frac{L_{-i}}{n(n-1)/2}$

L<sub>-i</sub>: Alters间的实际连结数;   
n: 量级（# Alters）

::: {.fragment}

$d_{YH} = \frac{5}{6(6 - 1)/2} \approx 0.33.$

:::

[*如果网络是有向的，怎么办？*]{.fragment}

::: {.notes}

n(n-1)/2 是无向网络中可能存在的所有connections，如果是有向网络则不用除以2

:::

:::

### 应用实例

🌰 Security Egonets [@Maoz2010]

+ 目标：在国际网络中，国家何时动武
+ 假设：国家的Strategic Reference Group (SRG)越大，其越有可能在外交政策中施用争端性政策工具（如介入MID或战争）
+ 数据源：新独立国家独立五年内和已独立国家发生MID五年内的国际环境。
+ 测量： SRG，[以国家为Ego]{.red}，测量与其产生敌对关系、冲突的国家及国家联盟

:::{.notes}

Maoz, Zeev. 2010. Networks of Nations: The Evolution, Structure, and Impact of International Networks, 1816–2001. Cambridge University Press.

MID: Militarized interstate disputes

:::


::: {.fragment}

🌰 Power of weak ties [@RochEtAl2000]

+ 目标: SNA对纳税人税收政策态度影响
+ 理论：动机和能力 &rarr; weak ties （同事、熟人等） 
+ 假设：人们从weak ties比从strong ties获取更多对税务的知识 &rarr; 与strong ties 一起决定对照章纳税的态度

:::

:::{.notes}

所以司马南应该没有很多照章纳税的同事、熟人

:::

### 测量同质性

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="50%"}

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_coauthorHomophily.png){height=550}

:::

:::{.column width="50%" .fragment}

|        | Same  | Different |
|--------|-------|-----------|
| Tie    | (a) 5 | (b) 6     |
| No tie | (c) 4 | (d) 6     |

**Homophily**: 

- Yule's Q = (ad - bc)/(ad + bc)s
- EI = (b - a)/(b + a)


:::

::::

:::{.notes}

Same: n(n - 1)/2: Black 4 \* 3 /2  = 6; yellow 3 \* 2 /2 = 3, 6 + 3 = 9, 5 of them connected, no tie = 9 - 5 = 4

Different: 3 yellow * 4 black = 12, 有 tie 6, 无 12 - 6

:::

---

**Heterogeneity**

- Blau's H: H = 1 - &sum;p<sub>i</sub><sup>2</sup>
- Index of Qualitative Variation (IQV): H/(1-1/r)^[p: i所属类连结比例, r: 总共类别]

:::{.fragment}

🌰 某甲有九亲、四友、十二同僚，其路野乎？

Alters = 9 + 4 + 12 = 25

:::

:::{.fragment}

p<sub>亲</sub> = 9/25;    
p<sub>友</sub> = 4/25;    
p<sub>僚</sub> = 12/25.

:::

:::{.fragment}

H = 1 - [(4/25)<sup>2</sup> + (12/25)<sup>2</sup> + (9/25)<sup>2</sup>] = 0.6144

:::

:::{.fragment}

IQV = 0.6144/(1 - 1/3) = 0.9216

:::

## 结构洞 [Structural Holes, @Burt2009]

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_structuralHole.jpg){height=300 fig-align="center"}

1. Ego的冗余性: Effective Size<sub>binary</sub> = Ties<sub>Ego</sub> - Ties<sub>Alters</sub>
1. Alters对于Ego的限制: Constraint<sub>ij</sub> = (p<sub>ij</sub> + &sum;<sub>q</sub>p<sub>iq</sub>p<sub>jq</sub>)<sup>2</sup>, q &ne; i,j
1. 不考虑Ego情况下Alters的连接情况, betweenness: $$C_B(i) = \sum_{i\neq j\neq k}(\frac{\sigma_{kij}}{\sigma{kj}})$$

:::{.notes}
Burt, Ronald S. 2009. Structural Holes: The Social Structure of Competition. Harvard University Press.

A is a structural hole

p<sub>ij</sub>: proportional strength of i's relationship with j

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_constraint.png)

&sigma;<kij>: #shortest paths between k and j blocked by i,     
&sigma;<kj>: #shortest paths between k and j. 
:::

## 基础测量

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

*Degree ~*

$$
C_D(i) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}n_{ji}, j \neq i.
$$

:::{.fragment style="margin-top: 2em"}

- 关注点：local network, ego connect
- 目标：Activity，与别人的连接度

:::

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

*Eigenvector ~*^[$AX = \lambda X, \det(A - \lambda I) = 0.$]

$$
C_E(i) = k^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^{n}A_{ji}C_E(j).
$$


:::{.fragment style="margin-top: 1em"}

- 关注点：近邻关系 
    - 可以看作degree centrality 改进版

:::

::: {.notes}

An eigenvector is a special vector that, when multiplied by a matrix, only changes in scale (gets longer or shorter) but keeps pointing in the same direction.

Imagine you have a transformation (like a stretch, rotation, or reflection) represented by a matrix. When you apply this transformation to most vectors, they change direction. But eigenvectors are special - they only get stretched or shrunk while maintaining their original direction.

:::

:::

::::

## Degree vs. Eigenvector


![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_dECentrality.bmp){fig-align="center" height=600}

::: {.notes}

eigenvector centrality能更好考虑连结的质量。

You want to identify nodes that might not have many connections but are connected to highly influential nodes。

:::


## 专门测量

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

*Betweenness*

$$
C_B(i) = \sum_{j,k}\frac{\delta_{jik}}{\delta_{jk}}, i\neq j\neq k.
$$

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_betweenness.bmp){fig-align="center" height=300}

目标：Potential controls

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

*Closeness* 

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_closeness.png){fig-align="center" height=400}

目标：Independence, 与[每个]{.red}结点的关系

:::

::::

### 应用实例


+ "Who are people turning to" &rarr; in-degree centrality [@KleinEtAl2004]
+ "Reputation" &rarr; alpha centrality [@RossmanEtAl2010]
+ "Well-connected and powerful" &rarr; eigenvector centrality [@Box-SteffensmeierEtAl2013]
+  从关系测量“软实力” &rarr; closeness [@HuYueOuYangRui2023]


:::{.notes}

团队研究，Academy of Management Journal

Klein, Katherine J., Beng-Chong Lim, Jessica L. Saltz, and David M. Mayer. 2004. “How Do They Get There? An Examination of the Antecedents of Centrality in Team Networks.” Academy of Management Journal 47(6): 952–63.


Congress合作， PA

Fowler, James H. 2006. “Connecting the Congress: A Study of Cosponsorship Networks.” Political Analysis 14(4): 456–87.


学术网络 American Sociological Review

Rossman, Gabriel, Nicole Esparza, and Phillip Bonacich. 2010. “I’d Like to Thank the Academy, Team Spillovers, and Network Centrality.” American Sociological Review 75(1): 31–51.


APSR 司法判决

Box Steffensmeier, Janet, Dino P. Christensen, and Matthew P. Hitt. 2013. “Quality Over Quantity: Amici Influence and Judicial Decision Making.” American Political Science Review 107(3): 446–60.

:::

![](https://drhuyue.site:10002/sammo3182/figure/sna_centralities.png){fig-align="center" height=600}

:::{.notes}

All are correct

1. degree: activity
1. eigenvector: advanced degree, accounting for neighbors
1. betweenness: potential control
1. closeness: independence
